intro: Euphrasia cheesemanii, commonly known as the Cheeseman's eyebright, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often in alpine regions. It has a short, erect stem with opposite, ovate leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Euphrasia cheesemanii is a rare species, with limited distribution and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
